chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the LORD, concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite.
items.plainText: Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the Lord, concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite.

items.text: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:
items.plainText: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

items.text: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
items.plainText: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

items.text: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
items.plainText: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

items.text: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)
items.plainText: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

items.text: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
items.plainText: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

items.text: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.
items.plainText: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

items.text: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
items.plainText: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

items.text: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.
items.plainText: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

items.text: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
items.plainText: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

items.text: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.
items.plainText: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

items.text: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
items.plainText: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

items.text: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
items.plainText: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

items.text: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
items.plainText: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

items.text: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
items.plainText: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

items.text: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
items.plainText: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

items.text: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
items.plainText: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

items.text: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
items.plainText: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
